intro: Tristaniopsis razakiana, commonly known as the Bornean tree fern, is a species native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant exhibits a unique growth pattern, with a distinct crown of fronds that can reach several meters in height. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
